image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiles at a medical staff at a press conference inside a hospital

props.synopsis: Both federal Labor and the Coalition have pledged to contribute $150 million towards a new $300 million healthcare centre planned at Flinders University.

title.children: Bipartisan support to invest $150m for health training hub in SA

image.altText: Flames and smoke coming from a low scrubby area

props.synopsis: The South Australian Country Fire Service (CFS) says the threat from a bushfire burning near Robe, in the state's south-east, has reduced.

title.children: Reduced threat from bushfire burning near Robe in south-east SA

image.altText: Dead fish by a boot, for size reference. The boot is a quarter of the fish's length.

props.synopsis: Residents say they have seen fish and other marine life washed ashore in the days since a large-scale toxic algae bloom and fish kill at Fleurieu Peninsula beaches.

title.children: Kangaroo Islanders report 'hundreds' of dead fish on beaches

image.altText: Black and yellow packets of cigarettes in a white drawer full of packs.

props.synopsis: A decline in cigarette sales amid a boom in illegal tobacco has added to the stress for small businesses already struggling.

title.children: Cigarette retailers struggle as smokers turn to black market

image.altText: an image of a car's driver side mirror with a truck reflected, driving through a town

props.synopsis: A freight bypass estimated to divert up to 420,000 trucks a year from congested Adelaide thoroughfares is back on the agenda following the federal budget.

title.children: Long-awaited SA freight route back on table ahead of federal election

image.altText: Jake Lehmann raises his bat and helmet after making a century

props.synopsis: The sea shanty Bound for South Australia has become an anthem that celebrates the distinctiveness of a state not necessarily renowned for distinction, especially on the sporting field. But the song captures the sentiment of the state's remarkable Sheffield Shield win, writes Daniel Keane.

title.children: The Sheffield Shield was Bound for South Australia, now it has arrived

image.altText: Aerial view of Tarrkarri -  a vast beige mushroom with landscaped gardens in the centre of the CBD

props.synopsis: SA Premier Peter Malinauskas has announced more funding for the arts, but none to help build a long-delayed First Nations cultural centre in Adelaide's CBD.

title.children: Dream for SA First Nations cultural centre 'still alive', Premier says

image.altText: People in costumes perform onstage at the 13th Confucius Institute Conference in Chengdu

props.synopsis: Australia's leading universities cut ties with Confucius Institutes, but don’t cite concerns of foreign interference.

title.children: Confucius Institutes quietly disappear from six Australian universities

image.altText: Nicola Spurrier is dressed in a multi-coloured jacket as she addresses the media

props.synopsis: More than 2,300 cases of the flu have been recorded in SA so far this year — 690 more than the same time last year — and the government is urging parents with young children to get their free vaccination.

title.children: Parents urged to get children vaccinated as flu cases rise in SA

image.altText: A man adjusts his tie as he looks at a journalist who sits opposite him

props.synopsis: At this time last year, David Speirs was adamant his position as SA Liberal leader was "100 per cent secure". But the past 12 months have brought almost nothing other than challenges for the now 40-year-old, who last week stood in the dock.

title.children: David Speirs has gone from '100 per cent secure' to a guilty plea

image.altText: An aerial view of vast flooding in the outback.

props.synopsis: Record-breaking rainfall has drenched outback Queensland in the past week and authorities are scrambling to repair broken levees.

title.children: Worst flooding in 50 years ravages outback Queensland

image.altText: Sliding glass doors into a building with the words Reserve Bank of Australia written above.

props.synopsis: The ASX gained ground on Tuesday as the Reserve Bank kept interest rates steady. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX gains ground as RBA stays on hold

image.altText: Qasseem lies on his back on a stretcher, with his legs and lower torso under a blanket and a purple cloth covering his face.

props.synopsis: Some of the worst violence in years drives members of a minority sect linked to fallen Syrian leader Bashar al-Assad to flee for their lives, and many worry the new government is not serious about punishing those responsible.

title.children: Anger as fallen Syrian regime turns to deadly violence

image.altText: A woman in a hospital bed with bruises on her face.

props.synopsis: Virginia Giuffre, a prominent accuser of Jeffrey Epstein and Prince Andrew, says she has "four days to live" after being in a serious accident.

title.children: Virginia Giuffre's spokesperson says she was in serious crash

image.altText: A blue lake, with a green cliff and a rural city stretching on behind the cliff.

props.synopsis: More than 18,000 people are expected to move to SA's Limestone Coast in the next 25 years, but local leaders say a mountain of work needs to be done.

title.children: Mount Gambier is tipped to boom, but leaders say infrastructure is lacking

image.altText: Elephants in the water.

props.synopsis: Botswana's elephant population has doubled in recent decades, creating chaos for many who live alongside them.

title.children: 'Elephants are terrorists': The unintended consequences of an African triumph

image.altText: A still from CCTV footage shows three security guards (faces blurred) surrounding a man on the ground

props.synopsis: Footage emerges of three government-funded security guards kicking and stomping on a man on a Darwin street.

title.children: NT pseudo-cops filmed kicking a man's head like a soccer ball

image.altText: A mocked-up illustration shows a train moving past a station labelled 'Airport 1'.

props.synopsis: Federal Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says a Coalition government would fund Melbourne's Airport Rail Link project and scrap federal funding for the Victorian government's Suburban Rail Loop, which he calls a "cruel hoax".

title.children: Airport rail prioritised, Victorian Suburban Rail Loop dumped under Dutton

image.altText: A person with manicured nails holding a RAT test

props.synopsis: In recent years, the familiar symptoms of the flu might kick us into reaching for at-home testing kits. But on the eve of the next flu season, public health experts say the best approach is what we've always done.

title.children: You think you have the flu. Is it even worth using a RAT?

image.altText: Minjee and Min Woo Lee at the Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Min Woo Lee plans on celebrating his watershed Houston Open victory with sister Minjee after they became only the third siblings to notch wins on the respective PGA and LPGA Tours.

title.children: Min Woo Lee admits he's not the best golfer in his family

image.altText: A woman wearing Islamic headdress crying in a town square, supported by other women.

props.synopsis: The Palestinian Red Crescent Society and Gaza's civil defence agency staff disappeared last week, after the Israel Defense Forces opened fire on a convoy of ambulance and fire trucks.

title.children: Bodies of Palestinian medics and emergency crews recovered in southern Gaza

image.altText: Kid Rock in a bright red suit with stars stands next to Donald Trump sitting at a desk in the oval office.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump signed the directive in the Oval Office, with singer Kid Rock standing next to him in an American flag-themed outfit.

title.children: Trump joined by Kid Rock as he signs ticket scalping executive order

image.altText: A woman in a blue jacket

props.synopsis: A Paris court has convicted French far-right leader Marine Le Pen of embezzling money from the European parliament.

title.children: French far-right leader handed five-year ban from office

image.altText: a house for sale in the brisbane suburb of stafford with the sale sign in the front yard

props.synopsis: After a brief downturn home prices have rebounded to new heights, but analysts say growth is likely to be contained. Rents have also reached record highs but growth is expected to slow.

title.children: Home prices and rents reach record highs ahead of rates decision

image.altText: Several silver Teslas in a yard appear fire damaged

props.synopsis: A Tesla dealership on the eastern outskirts of Rome goes up in flames, destroying 17 cars and prompting the company's billionaire chief executive to blame "terrorism".

title.children: Fire at Tesla dealership in Rome destroys 17 cars, Musk blames 'terrorism'

image.altText: Man in jacket and broad-brimmed hat in doorway with floodwaters

props.synopsis: Ferocious floodwaters in outback Queensland have not only taken homes, but entire livelihoods.

title.children: 'Bloody devastating': Graziers left speechless by outback flooding

image.altText: Excavators and diggers working in a large peat bog in the middle of a European forest.

props.synopsis: Authorities are still searching for a fourth soldier, after the armoured vehicle they were travelling in went missing while participating in a military drill.

title.children: Bodies of three US soldiers found after vehicle sank in Lithuania swamp

image.altText: A sticker on a product saying Australia made with a kangaroo symbol

props.synopsis: Australians are being encouraged to swap American goods for home-grown products at the check-out, but is it that easy?

title.children: Can Australians really ditch US products? The data says it's complicated

image.altText: Baby orange-bellied parrots held in a man's hand.

props.synopsis: The endangered orange-bellied parrot has lost 62 per cent of its genetic diversity and can only be saved by breeding with another species or editing its genes, a study suggests.

title.children: Endangered parrot’s genetic decline has put it in an 'extinction vortex'

image.altText: A long neon lit hallway with doors to cells.

props.synopsis: Human rights lawyers and Aboriginal leaders lodge a complaint urging the United Nations to address Australia's "discriminatory" and "punitive" youth justice policies.

title.children: UN to decide on 'cruel and inhumane' youth crime policies

image.altText: A woman in a red sweater smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: After years of doing three gigs a night, Ugandan-born, Brisbane-based comedian Anisa Nandaula was finally able to follow her passion right to the Melbourne International Comedy Festival.

title.children: Meet the comedian who traded a six-figure salary for stand-up

image.altText: Seven workers in high-viz clothing controls a person on a stretcher who is being hoisted down from a ruined building

props.synopsis: More than three days since the massive earthquake that rocked the region, rescuers are finding survivors under the rubble but time is fast running out to save others who haven't been found.

title.children: More than 2,000 killed by Myanmar quake, desperate rescue efforts continue

image.altText: dad on phone while holding his toddler

props.synopsis: While there is no research to indicate swearing around children is directly harmful, some experts say it may be damaging in ways we don't expect.

title.children: Is it OK to swear in front of our kids?

image.altText: the US and China flags both hang separately but next to each other

props.synopsis: The six individuals targeted by the sanctions include Hong Kong's police chief and a senior justice secretary.

title.children: Donald Trump's government sanctions Chinese officials

props.synopsis: It's just a TV show, it's not real, but the series Adolescence has really got people talking. The Netflix crime drama is about a teenage boy accused of murdering a female classmate and it takes the issues of toxic masculinity, loneliness and the gender divide to the extreme.

title.children: Why 'Adolescence' is a wake-up call for parents
